title: Italian Cooking Vocabulary
description: From antipasto to zabaglione, explore the rich vocabulary of Italian cuisine

questions.question: In Italian cooking, what does 'antipasto' literally mean?
options: Before the meal â€” a course of appetizers

questions.question: What is 'risotto' in Italian cuisine?
options: A creamy rice dish cooked slowly with broth and stirred frequently

questions.question: What does 'prosciutto' refer to in Italian food?
options: Dry-cured Italian ham, typically sliced very thin

questions.question: In Italian cuisine, what is 'bruschetta'?
options: Grilled bread rubbed with garlic and topped with ingredients like tomatoes and basil

questions.question: What does the Italian term 'carpaccio' describe?
options: Thinly sliced raw meat or fish, typically served as an appetizer

questions.question: What is 'mascarpone' in Italian cooking?
options: A rich, creamy Italian cheese often used in tiramisu

questions.question: In Italian cuisine, what does 'pesto' literally mean?
options: Pounded or crushed, referring to the traditional mortar-and-pestle preparation

questions.question: What is 'pancetta' in Italian cooking?
options: Italian cured pork belly, similar to bacon but not smoked

questions.question: What does 'osso buco' literally translate to in Italian?
options: Bone with a hole, referring to braised veal shanks

questions.question: In Italian food terminology, what is 'gnocchi'?
options: Small, soft dumplings typically made from potatoes and flour

questions.question: What does 'aglio e olio' mean in Italian cooking?
options: Garlic and oil, a simple pasta preparation

questions.question: What is 'zabaglione' in Italian cuisine?
options: A light, warm custard dessert made with egg yolks, sugar, and wine

questions.question: In Italian cooking, what does 'soffritto' refer to?
options: A flavor base of finely diced onion, celery, and carrot cooked in olive oil

questions.question: What is 'affogato' in Italian food culture?
options: A dessert of vanilla ice cream or gelato drowned in a shot of espresso

questions.question: What does 'arancini' refer to in Italian cuisine?
options: Stuffed rice balls coated in breadcrumbs and deep-fried
